intro: Neuracanthus tetragonostachyus subsp. trinervius, commonly known as the three-veined flameflower, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has lance-shaped, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
